text: {{Infobox settlement | name = South Sinai Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Governadorat_de_Sinai_del_sud.png | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Coat of arms of South Sinai Governorate.png | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = South Sinai in Egypt.svg | map_caption = South Sinai Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = El Tor (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 33,140 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 104000 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = 3.14 | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} South Sinai Governorate is a governorate in Egypt. The capital city is El Tor. It has the fewest people of any governorate in Egypt. It is on the southern half of the Sinai Peninsula. Saint Catherine's Monastery, an Eastern Orthodox Church monastery and UNESCO World Heritage site, is in the central part of the governorate. Raithu Monastery is in El Tor. Other important sites in the governorate are Wadi Mukattab and Wadi Feiran. ==Cities and towns== * Dahab * El Tor * Nuweiba * Saint Catherine * Sharm El Sheikh * Taba ==References== Category:Sinai Peninsula
title: South Sinai Governorate
